spell.name: Avatar of Nature
entries: *(Druid)*
- **Frequency** Legendary
You call upon primal and elemental forces to aid you, you become the avatar of their might and wrath.
While in this form you gain the following
-  Imunity to fire, cold and lightning
-  Resistance to all but Psychic, necrotic and radiant
-  your Base speed doubles, and gain equal fly(hover) and swiming speed
-  you gain a burrow speed of 30ft
-  You nolonger need air, and cant be {@condition charmed} or put to sleep
-  one size larger
-  you gain 50 temp hp and gain 10 temp hp at the start of your turn
-  YOu gain +2 to ac and an additional action, this action can be used for a singular atack or feature, but not spellcasting

-  As a Bonus Action when you hit a creature with an non-spell atack you can deal {@dice 2d8} Lightning, Cold, Thunder, Fire, Poison, Acid, Bludedgeoning, piercing or slashing dmg. You can use your reaction to add {@dice 1d10} of the same element to one nonspell atack you see with in 120ft

-  Land stride. You are under the effects of tree stride, and as a BA can teleport to any spot you can see with in 60ft that is non worked stone or metal. You cant be slowed by terrain or weather, including from druid spells such as plant growth

- Elemental Quagmire. as an action , You can place up to 4 areas of dificult terrain, Choosing Earth , Air, Fire , Water or Oak. this areas are 30ft of radius, whenever you use this feature you may change or move the type of each individual area, when they apear you may choose all be diferent or the same. Earth, the area is affected by the spike growth spell. Air The area is affected by the sleet storm effect, Fire acts as touching a wall of fire(dex save to jup out the area as it apears), Water creates a 30ft radius sphere of water under Control water's whirpool's effect and Oak Creates a 30ft area affected by  Plant growth's speed reduction and entangle restrain
Whenever you use this action you can choose any number of creatures to be immune to any speed reduction from this feature

-  Healing Spirits. As an action you may heal all creatures of your choice by {@dice 3d8}+wisdom with in a 300ft radious, This also ends the Paralyzed , Poisoned conditions and ends any mundane illness on those creatures

trait.name: Non-Euclidian
entries: Cthulhu does not exist wholly in the physical world, and space and time strain against his presence. This grants Cthulhu a deflection bonus to AC of 10 + Charisma +Dex .
His apparent and actual position are never quite the same, All atacks against him have disadvantage, creatures cant gain advantage on atacks against him.
Creatures With True sight may make a dc 26 wisdom save to nagate the disadvantage

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Cthulhu has advantage against spells and other magical effects

trait.name: Eldritch Truth
entries: This effect triggers only once, no mater how many creatures with the feature have it , and the effect is based on the highest DC.

First time a Creature witness Cthulhu, it must make an inteligence check vs its own inteligence score, on a success the creature understands the implications of the Eldritch Truth and must make a DC26 Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} until saves. While frigtened this way the creature gains 1 lvl of madness at the start of their turn. The creature saves against this at the end of their turn, on a success the {@condition frightened} condition ends, but not any madness.

Creatures imune to Psychic, with the Mind Blank Spell or immune to the {@condition frightened} condition are imune to this effect. A creature that saves is imune to this feature for 24 hours or until they witness a higher DC eldritch truth

trait.name: It has awoken (Recharges on a LR or SR)
entries: When Cthulhu is reduces to 0 hp he can force himself to manifest more compleatetly in the material plane or simply return to his domain in the void.

If he chooses to awake , He gains immunity to the Frightened  and Charmed Condition, his HP and Spells Reset  as if he took a long rest, his Legendary resistances reset and gains access to his mythic actions.
If Awoken Cthulhu is reduced to 0 hp while in the material plane it melts into a 500ft radius cloudkill as his consiousness returns to the void.
If Awoken Cthulhu is reduced to 0hp while in his domain, his hp is restored and he returns to his not awoken version. looses access to all given by this feature.

Cthulhu can only be permanently destroyed by reducing  him to 0hp in his domain, and  plane shift his compleate form to the  material plane , where he would truely die vanishing like a nightmare as his abstract form becomes succeptible to the concept of material death

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/SR)
entries: When fails a save can choose to sacceed

trait.name: Everpresent Tendrils (While awoken)
entries: All Creatures of Cthulhu's choice that start a turn with in 10 miles of him must make a Dc21 Dex save or be {@condition grappled} and Restrained (Escape {@dc 26}).

trait.name: Greater Starflight
entries: Cthulhu can travel to any point in a single star system, arriving ind {@dice 2d6} hours.
Cthulhu Can travel to any other point in the same Universe , arriving with in  {@dice 2d6} days.
Cthulhu requires no food, air or drink

action.name: Multiatack
entries: Cthulhu Makes 4 atacks, can replace 1 atack with an at will spell

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 4d6 + 10}) Slashing damage.
If Cthulhu scores a critical hit against a creature traveling by means of the astral projection spell, Cthulhu can cut the target's silver cord instead of dealing damage.

action.name: Devour
entries: As an action Cthulhu consumes all creatures he is grappling, all creatures must make a {@dc 23} Strenght save or take {@damage 18d6} force damage. A creature reduced to 0 hp is consumed, Cthulhu regains 100hp per sentient creature consumend. Consumed creatures can only be resurrected by a True Resurrection spell, Wish, Divine intervention or similar magic

action.name: Tentacles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d6 + 10}) Bludgeoning damage plus {@h}17 ({@damage 2d6 + 10}) psychic damage.
A creature hit by this atack is Grappled and Restrained by Cthulhu (escape DC26)

action.name: Dream of Cthulhu
entries: All creatures with in 10 miles of Cthulhu must make a DC26 wisdom saving throw or be affected by the Dominate monster Spell. a Protection against evil spell prevents this feature. A creature that saves is imune to this for 24 hours

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Cthulhu can cast the following spells with out components, Cthulhu can concentrate on to 2 spells at a time, each use diferetn concentrations
DC26 and +18 to hit
will: {@spell telekinesis} (Can target up to 6 large or smaller creatures, or 3 Huge)
{@spell telepathy} (Can target other planes like sending)

3e: {@spell gate} (summons2d4 starspawn or a cr25 or lower aberation)

legendary.name: Teleport (1 LA)
entries: Cthulhu Teleports  to any point with in 300ft

legendary.name: Atack or cast a spell (2 LA)
entries: Cthulhu makes an atack or cast an at will spell

legendary.name: Psionic Singularity (3 actions)
entries: All creatures with an into of 5 or hight with in 10 miles  must make a dc26 int save or take {@dice 6d10} psychic dmg and be stuned till the end of their turn, half dmg on a save and no stun. Cthulhu instantly learns all that the creatures that failed the save know provided the creature is not protected by a protection against evil and good spell or similar magic

mythic.name: Non-Euclidian Singularity (3 MA)
entries: The world arround Cthulhu becomes a clashing Non-Euclidian maelstorm, all creatures 10 miles of Cthulhu must make a dc26 wisdom save or take {@dice 10d10} psychic dmg , be affected by the confusion spell and have their speed halved, the effect ends when the creature is restored by a greater restoration or saves at the end of their turn

mythic.name: Psionic Backlash (2 MA)
entries: Up to 8 creatures Cthulhu can see that are {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell take {@dice 6d6} psychic dmg, if they fail their {@status concentration} save they are {@condition stunned} till the end of their turn

entries: {@actSave dex} {@dc 16}, each creature in a 60-foot-long, 5-foot-wide {@variantrule Line [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Line}. {@actSaveFail} 55 ({@damage 10d10}) Lightning damage. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragon makes three Rend attacks. It can replace two attacks with a use of Sleep Breath.

action.name: Rend
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 7}, reach 10 ft. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) Slashing damage.

action.name: Fire Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: {@actSave dex} {@dc 14}, each creature in a 40-foot-long, 5-foot-wide {@variantrule Line [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Line}. {@actSaveFail} 38 ({@damage 11d6}) Fire damage. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage.

action.name: Sleep Breath
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 14}, each creature in a 30-foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone}. {@actSaveFail} The target has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition until the end of its next turn, at which point it repeats the save. {@actSaveFail 2} The target has the {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} condition for 1 minute. This effect ends for the target if it takes damage or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to wake it.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The dragon can breathe air and water.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragon makes three Rend attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Repulsion Breath.

action.name: Rend
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 8}, reach 10 ft. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) Slashing damage.

action.name: Lightning Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: {@actSave dex} {@dc 15}, each creature in a 60-foot-long, 5-foot-wide {@variantrule Line [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Line}. {@actSaveFail} 49 ({@damage 9d10}) Lightning damage. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage.

action.name: Repulsion Breath
entries: {@actSave str} {@dc 15}, each creature in a 30-foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone}. {@actSaveFail} The target is pushed up to 40 feet straight away from the dragon and has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragon makes three Rend attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Slowing Breath.

action.name: Rend
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 7}, reach 10 ft. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) Slashing damage.

action.name: Acid Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: {@actSave dex} {@dc 14}, each creature in a 40-foot-long, 5-foot-wide {@variantrule Line [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Line}. {@actSaveFail} 40 ({@damage 9d8}) Acid damage. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage.

action.name: Slowing Breath
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 14}, each creature in a 30-foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone}. {@actSaveFail} The target can't take Reactions; its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is halved; and it can take either an action or a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on its turn, not both. This effect lasts until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The dragon can breathe air and water.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragon makes three Rend attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Weakening Breath.

action.name: Rend
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 10}, reach 10 ft. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) Slashing damage.

action.name: Fire Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: {@actSave dex} {@dc 17}, each creature in a 30-foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone}. {@actSaveFail} 55 ({@damage 10d10}) Fire damage. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage.

action.name: Weakening Breath
entries: {@actSave str} {@dc 17}, each creature that isn't currently affected by this breath in a 30-foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone}. {@actSaveFail} The target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Strength-based {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB|D20 Tests} and subtracts 3 ({@dice 1d6}) from its damage rolls. It repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.

action.name: Paralyzing Breath
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 17}, each creature in a 30-foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone}. {@actSaveFail 1} The target has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition until the end of its next turn, when it repeats the save. {@actSaveFail 2} The target has the {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB} condition, and it repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.

trait.name: Ice Walk
entries: The dragon can move across and climb icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB} composed of ice or snow doesn't cost it extra movement.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragon makes three Rend attacks.

action.name: Rend
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 7}, reach 10 ft. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) Slashing damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) Cold damage.

action.name: Cold Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 15}, each creature in a 30-foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone}. {@actSaveFail} 40 ({@damage 9d8}) Cold damage. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage.

monster.name: Aspect of Tiamat

trait.name: Chromatic Wrath (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If the aspect would be reduced to 0 hit points, her current hit point total instead resets to 500 hit points, she recharges her Chromatic Flames, and she regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the aspect can now use the options in the "Mythic Actions" section for 1 hour. Award a party an additional 155,000 XP (310,000 XP total) for defeating the aspect of Tiamat after her Chromatic Wrath activates.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (5/Day)
entries: If the aspect fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The aspect makes one Bite attack, one Claw attack, and one Tail attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 2d12 + 10}) piercing damage plus 19 ({@damage 3d12}) force damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 2d10 + 10}) slashing damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 20}) and is {@condition restrained} until this grapple ends. The aspect can have only one creature {@condition grappled} this way at a time.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 2d12 + 10}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 27} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Chromatic Flames {@recharge 5}
entries: The aspect exhales multicolored flames in a 300-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 27} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 71 ({@damage 11d12}) damage of a type of the aspect's choosing: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The aspect makes one Claw or Tail attack.

legendary.name: Furious Bite (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The aspect makes one Bite attack. If the attack hits a creature, the target must succeed on a {@dc 27} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of the aspect until the end of its next turn.

mythicHeader: If the aspect's Chromatic Wrath trait has activated in the last hour, she can use the options below as legendary actions.

mythic.name: Hurl Through Avernus (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The aspect targets a creature she is grappling. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 25} Charisma saving throw or take 44 ({@damage 8d10}) psychic damage and be banished to Avernus (the first layer of the Nine Hells). At the start of the aspect's next turn, the creature reappears in an unoccupied space within 10 feet of the aspect.

mythic.name: Chromatic Flare (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The aspect flares with elemental energy. Each creature of the aspect's choice in a 60-foot-radius sphere centered on her must make a {@dc 27} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 39 ({@damage 6d12}) damage of a type chosen by the aspect: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage.

monster.name: Black Greatwyrm

trait.name: Chromatic Awakening (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If the greatwyrm would be reduced to 0 hit points, its current hit point total instead resets to 425 hit points, it recharges its Breath Weapon, and it regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the greatwyrm can now use the options in the "Mythic Actions" section for 1 hour. Award a party an additional 105,000 XP (210,000 XP total) for defeating the greatwyrm after its Chromatic Awakening activates.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
entries: If the greatwyrm fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The greatwyrm doesn't require food or drink.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The greatwyrm makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 18} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 2d10 + 10}) piercing damage plus 13 ({@damage 2d12}) force damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 18} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d8 + 10}) slashing damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 20}) and is {@condition restrained} until this grapple ends. The greatwyrm can have only one creature {@condition grappled} this way at a time.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 18} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d8 + 10}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 26} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Breath Weapon {@recharge 5}
entries: The greatwyrm exhales a blast of energy in a 300-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 26} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 78 ({@damage 12d12}) acid damage. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The greatwyrm makes one Claw or Tail attack.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The greatwyrm beats its wings. Each creature within 30 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 26} Dexterity saving throw or take 17 ({@damage 2d6 + 10}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. The greatwyrm can then fly up to half its flying speed.

legendary.name: Arcane Spear (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The greatwyrm creates four spears of magical force. Each spear hits a creature of the greatwyrm's choice it can see within 120 feet of it, dealing 12 ({@damage 1d8 + 8}) force damage to its target, then disappears.

mythicHeader: If the greatwyrm's Chromatic Awakening trait has activated in the last hour, it can use the options below as legendary actions.

mythic.name: Bite
entries: The greatwyrm makes one Bite attack.

mythic.name: Chromatic Flare (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The greatwyrm flares with elemental energy. Each creature in a 60-foot-radius sphere centered on the greatwyrm must succeed on a {@dc 26} Dexterity saving throw or take 22 ({@damage 5d8}) acid damage.

variant.name: Customizing Dragons
entries: You can customize any dragon's stat block to reflect the dragon's unique character. Minor changes such as those below are easy to make and have no impact on a dragon's challenge rating.

entries.name: Languages
entries: Most dragons prefer to speak Draconic but learn Common for dealing with allies and minions. But given their high Intelligence and long life span, dragons can easily learn additional languages. You can add languages to a dragon's stat block.

entries.name: Skills
entries: Most dragons are proficient in the {@skill Perception} and {@skill Stealth} skills, and many dragons have additional skill proficiencies. As with languages, you can customize a dragon's skill list (even doubling their proficiency bonus with certain skills) to reflect particular interests and activities. You can also give a dragon tool proficiencies, particularly if the dragon spends time in Humanoid form.

entries.name: Spells
entries: {@note See the "Variant: Dragons as Innate Spellcasters" inset(s), below.}

entries.name: Other Traits and Actions
entries: You can borrow traits and actions from other monsters to add unique flavor to a dragon. Consider these examples:

items.name: Flyby
entries: The dragon is an agile flier, quick to fly out of enemies' reach.
The dragon doesn't provoke an opportunity attack when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

items.name: Mimicry
entries: Impersonating characters or their allies could be a fun trick for a crafty dragon.
The dragon can mimic any sounds it has heard, including voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful {@dc 16} Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check.

items.name: Rejuvenation
entries: You might decide that dragons in your campaign, being an essential part of the Material Plane, are nearly impossible to destroy. A dragon's life essence might be preserved in the egg from which it first emerged, in its hoard, or in a cavernous hall at the center of the world, just as a lich's essence is hidden in a phylactery.

If it has an essence-preserving object, a destroyed dragon gains a new body in {@dice 1d10} days, regaining all its hit points and becoming active again. The new body appears within 5 feet of the object.

items.name: Special Senses
entries: Most dragons have {@sense blindsight} and {@sense darkvision}. You might upgrade {@sense blindsight} to {@sense truesight}, or you could give a dragon with a burrowing speed {@sense tremorsense|MM}.

items.name: Tunneler
entries: The dragon can burrow through solid rock at half its burrowing speed and leaves a tunnel in its wake.

entries: The greatwyrm exhales a blast of energy in a 300-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 26} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 78 ({@damage 12d12}) fire damage. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The greatwyrm makes one Claw or Tail attack.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The greatwyrm beats its wings. Each creature within 30 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 26} Dexterity saving throw or take 17 ({@damage 2d6 + 10}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. The greatwyrm can then fly up to half its flying speed.

legendary.name: Arcane Spear (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The greatwyrm creates four spears of magical force. Each spear hits a creature of the greatwyrm's choice it can see within 120 feet of it, dealing 12 ({@damage 1d8 + 8}) force damage to its target, then disappears.

mythicHeader: If the greatwyrm's Chromatic Awakening trait has activated in the last hour, it can use the options below as legendary actions.

mythic.name: Bite
entries: The greatwyrm makes one Bite attack.

mythic.name: Chromatic Flare (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The greatwyrm flares with elemental energy. Each creature in a 60-foot-radius sphere centered on the greatwyrm must succeed on a {@dc 26} Dexterity saving throw or take 22 ({@damage 5d8}) fire damage.

variant.name: Customizing Dragons
entries: You can customize any dragon's stat block to reflect the dragon's unique character. Minor changes such as those below are easy to make and have no impact on a dragon's challenge rating.

entries.name: Languages
entries: Most dragons prefer to speak Draconic but learn Common for dealing with allies and minions. But given their high Intelligence and long life span, dragons can easily learn additional languages. You can add languages to a dragon's stat block.

entries.name: Skills
entries: Most dragons are proficient in the {@skill Perception} and {@skill Stealth} skills, and many dragons have additional skill proficiencies. As with languages, you can customize a dragon's skill list (even doubling their proficiency bonus with certain skills) to reflect particular interests and activities. You can also give a dragon tool proficiencies, particularly if the dragon spends time in Humanoid form.

entries.name: Spells
entries: {@note See the "Variant: Dragons as Innate Spellcasters" inset(s), below.}

entries.name: Other Traits and Actions
entries: You can borrow traits and actions from other monsters to add unique flavor to a dragon. Consider these examples:

items.name: Damage Absorption
entries: You might decide that this dragon is not only unharmed by fire damage, but actually healed by it.
Whenever the dragon is subjected to fire damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the fire damage dealt.

items.name: Flyby
entries: The dragon is an agile flier, quick to fly out of enemies' reach.
The dragon doesn't provoke an opportunity attack when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

items.name: Mimicry
entries: Impersonating characters or their allies could be a fun trick for a crafty dragon.
The dragon can mimic any sounds it has heard, including voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful {@dc 16} Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check.

items.name: Rejuvenation
entries: You might decide that dragons in your campaign, being an essential part of the Material Plane, are nearly impossible to destroy. A dragon's life essence might be preserved in the egg from which it first emerged, in its hoard, or in a cavernous hall at the center of the world, just as a lich's essence is hidden in a phylactery.

If it has an essence-preserving object, a destroyed dragon gains a new body in {@dice 1d10} days, regaining all its hit points and becoming active again. The new body appears within 5 feet of the object.

items.name: Special Senses
entries: Most dragons have {@sense blindsight} and {@sense darkvision}. You might upgrade {@sense blindsight} to {@sense truesight}, or you could give a dragon with a burrowing speed {@sense tremorsense|MM}.

items.name: Tunneler
entries: The dragon can burrow through solid rock at half its burrowing speed and leaves a tunnel in its wake.

monster.name: White Greatwyrm

trait.name: Chromatic Awakening (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If the greatwyrm would be reduced to 0 hit points, its current hit point total instead resets to 425 hit points, it recharges its Breath Weapon, and it regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the greatwyrm can now use the options in the "Mythic Actions" section for 1 hour. Award a party an additional 105,000 XP (210,000 XP total) for defeating the greatwyrm after its Chromatic Awakening activates.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
entries: If the greatwyrm fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The greatwyrm doesn't require food or drink.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The greatwyrm makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 18} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 2d10 + 10}) piercing damage plus 13 ({@damage 2d12}) force damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 18} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d8 + 10}) slashing damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 20}) and is {@condition restrained} until this grapple ends. The greatwyrm can have only one creature {@condition grappled} this way at a time.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 18} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d8 + 10}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 26} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

monster.name: Aspect of Bahamut

trait.name: Platinum Brilliance (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If the aspect would be reduced to 0 hit points, his current hit point total instead resets to 500 hit points, he recharges his Breath Weapon, and he regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the aspect can now use the options in the "Mythic Actions" section for 1 hour. Award a party an additional 155,000 XP (310,000 XP total) for defeating the aspect of Bahamut after his Platinum Brilliance activates.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (5/Day)
entries: If the aspect fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The aspect makes one Bite attack, one Claw attack, and one Tail attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 2d12 + 10}) piercing damage plus 22 ({@damage 4d10}) force damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 2d10 + 10}) slashing damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 20}) and is {@condition restrained} until this grapple ends. The aspect can have only one creature {@condition grappled} this way at a time.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 2d12 + 10}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 27} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Breath Weapon {@recharge 5}
entries: The aspect uses one of the following breath weapons:

items.name: Exalting Breath
entries: The aspect exhales the restoring winds of Mount Celestia in a 300-foot cone. Each creature in that area of the aspect's choice regains 71 ({@dice 13d10}) hit points, and each creature in that area of the aspect's choice that has been dead for no longer than 1 hour is restored to life with all its hit points.

items.name: Platinum Breath
entries: The aspect exhales radiant platinum flames in a 300-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 26} Dexterity saving throw, taking 66 ({@damage 12d10}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

bonus.name: Change Shape
entries: The aspect magically transforms into any Humanoid or Beast, while retaining his game statistics (other than his size). This transformation ends if the aspect is reduced to 0 hit points or if he uses a bonus action to end it.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The aspect makes one Claw or Tail attack.

legendary.name: Furious Bite (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The aspect makes one Bite attack. If the attack hits a creature, the target must succeed on a {@dc 27} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of the aspect until the end of the target's next turn.

mythicHeader: If the aspect's Platinum Brilliance trait has activated in the last hour, he can use the options below as legendary actions.

mythic.name: Celestial Shield (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The aspect manifests seven spectral {@creature ancient gold dragon||ancient gold dragons} around himself that protect him; he gains 77 temporary hit points until the start of his next turn.

mythic.name: Celestial Lances (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The aspect conjures four enormous lances of magical force that plummet to the ground at four different points he can see within 150 feet of him and then disappear. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius, 100-foot-high cylinder centered on each point must succeed on a {@dc 27} Dexterity saving throw or take 24 ({@damage 7d6}) force damage. A creature in the area of more than one lance is affected only once.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
entries: If the greatwyrm fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Metallic Awakening (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If the greatwyrm would be reduced to 0 hit points, its current hit point total instead resets to 450 hit points, it recharges its Breath Weapon, and it regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the greatwyrm can now use the options in the "Mythic Actions" section for 1 hour. items.name: Sapping Breath
entries: The greatwyrm exhales gas in a 300-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 25} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature falls {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature has disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws until the end of the greatwyrm's next turn. An {@condition unconscious} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries: The greatwyrm magically transforms into any creature that is Medium or Small, while retaining its game statistics (other than its size). This transformation ends if the dragon is reduced to 0 hit points or uses its action to end it.

items.name: Change Shape
entries: You can decide that a dragon acquires this action at a younger age than usual, particularly if you want to feature a dragon in Humanoid form in your campaign:

entries: The greatwyrm magically transforms into any creature that is Medium or Small, while retaining its game statistics (other than its size). This transformation ends if the dragon is reduced to 0 hit points or uses its action to end it.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The greatwyrm makes one Claw or Tail attack.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The greatwyrm beats its wings. Each creature within 30 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 26} Dexterity saving throw or take 17 ({@damage 2d6 + 10}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. The greatwyrm can then fly up to half its flying speed.

mythicHeader: If the greatwyrm's Metallic Awakening trait has activated in the last hour, it can use the options below as legendary actions.

mythic.name: Bite
entries: The greatwyrm makes one Bite attack.

mythic.name: Shattering Roar (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The greatwyrm unleashes a magical roar. Each creature in a 120-foot-radius sphere centered on the greatwyrm must succeed on a {@dc 26} Constitution saving throw or take 19 ({@damage 3d12}) thunder damage and be {@condition incapacitated} until the end of its next turn.

variant.name: Customizing Dragons
entries: You can customize any dragon's stat block to reflect the dragon's unique character. Minor changes such as those below are easy to make and have no impact on a dragon's challenge rating.

entries.name: Languages
entries: Most dragons prefer to speak Draconic but learn Common for dealing with allies and minions. But given their high Intelligence and long life span, dragons can easily learn additional languages. You can add languages to a dragon's stat block.

entries.name: Skills
entries: Most dragons are proficient in the {@skill Perception} and {@skill Stealth} skills, and many dragons have additional skill proficiencies. As with languages, you can customize a dragon's skill list (even doubling their proficiency bonus with certain skills) to reflect particular interests and activities. You can also give a dragon tool proficiencies, particularly if the dragon spends time in Humanoid form.

entries.name: Spells
entries: {@note See the "Variant: Dragons as Innate Spellcasters" inset(s), below.}

entries.name: Other Traits and Actions
entries: You can borrow traits and actions from other monsters to add unique flavor to a dragon. Consider these examples:

items.name: Change Shape
entries: You can decide that a dragon acquires this action at a younger age than usual, particularly if you want to feature a dragon in Humanoid form in your campaign:

The dragon magically polymorphs into a humanoid or beast that has a challenge rating no higher than its own, or back into its true form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the dragon's choice).

In a new form, the dragon retains its alignment, hit points, Hit Dice, ability to speak, proficiencies, Legendary Resistance, lair actions, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, as well as this action. Its statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.

items.name: Flyby
entries: The dragon is an agile flier, quick to fly out of enemies' reach.
The dragon doesn't provoke an opportunity attack when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

items.name: Mimicry
entries: Impersonating characters or their allies could be a fun trick for a crafty dragon.
The dragon can mimic any sounds it has heard, including voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful {@dc 18} Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check.

items.name: Rejuvenation
entries: You might decide that dragons in your campaign, being an essential part of the Material Plane, are nearly impossible to destroy. A dragon's life essence might be preserved in the egg from which it first emerged, in its hoard, or in a cavernous hall at the center of the world, just as a lich's essence is hidden in a phylactery.

If it has an essence-preserving object, a destroyed dragon gains a new body in {@dice 1d10} days, regaining all its hit points and becoming active again. The new body appears within 5 feet of the object.

items.name: Special Senses
entries: Most dragons have {@sense blindsight} and {@sense darkvision}. You might upgrade {@sense blindsight} to {@sense truesight}, or you could give a dragon with a burrowing speed {@sense tremorsense|MM}.

items.name: Tunneler
entries: The dragon can burrow through solid rock at half its burrowing speed and leaves a tunnel in its wake.

monster.name: Gold Greatwyrm

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
entries: If the greatwyrm fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Metallic Awakening (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If the greatwyrm would be reduced to 0 hit points, its current hit point total instead resets to 450 hit points, it recharges its Breath Weapon, and it regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the greatwyrm can now use the options in the "Mythic Actions" section for 1 hour. Award a party an additional 120,000 XP (240,000 XP total) for defeating the greatwyrm after its Metallic Awakening activates.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The greatwyrm doesn't require food or drink.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The greatwyrm makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 18} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 2d10 + 10}) piercing damage plus 13 ({@damage 2d12}) force damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 18} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d8 + 10}) slashing damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 20}) and is {@condition restrained} until this grapple ends. The greatwyrm can have only one creature {@condition grappled} in this way at a time.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 18} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 2d10 + 10}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 26} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Breath Weapon {@recharge 5}
entries: The greatwyrm uses one of the following breath weapons:

items.name: Elemental Breath
entries: The greatwyrm exhales elemental energy in a 300-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 25} Dexterity saving throw, taking 84 ({@damage 13d12}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Sapping Breath
entries: The greatwyrm exhales gas in a 300-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 25} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature falls {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature has disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws until the end of the greatwyrm's next turn. An {@condition unconscious} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
